results.name: Triangle read by rows: row sums, right and left borders are the Bell sequence, or a shifted variant. See Comments for precise definition.
comment: Consider A186020 as an infinite lower triangular matrix, and multiply the columns successively by the Bell numbers A000110, (1, 1, 2, 5, 15, 52,...).
Right and left borders = the Bell numbers, A000110: (1, 1, 2, 5, 15,...). Row sums = the shifted Bell numbers, (1, 2, 5, 15, 52,...).
Sum of n-th row terms = rightmost and leftmost terms of next row.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: T[n_] := Function[p, Table[If[i == n, p[[1]], Coefficient[p[[2]], x, i]], {i, 0, n}]][b[n]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 12 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
